title: Man Utd striker Marcus Rashford told how to become 'natural goalscorer'
text:

Manchester United striker Marcus Rashford has been told he is "not a natural goalscorer like Ian Wright or Gary Lineker".

Rashford was entrusted to lead the line by United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer this season after Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez left without being replaced in the summer.

The decision not to sign a new striker came back to bite United recently when both Rashford and Antony Martial were injured, leaving 17-year-old Mason Greenwood as the club's first-choice striker.

Rashford is only 21 himself, and has come under an increasing spotlight as United's season has gone from one low to another, with Solskjaer's future as manager in doubt after Sunday's 1-0 defeat to Newcastle .

And now Rashford has been told he needs to get in the box more, with United having scored just nine goals in eight Premier League matches this season, and having won only two of those games.

(Image: PA)

"He is not a natural centre forward," Paul Merson said of Rashford on The Debate on Sky Sports.

"He hasn't got that instinct. You need a goalscorer. He is not a natural goalscorer like Ian Wright or Gary Lineker.

"You have to get in the box if you are a real centre forward."

Rashford struggled in Sunday's defeat at Newcastle, with Graeme Souness blasting at half-time: "Is he on the pitch or is he coming on in the second half?"

(Image: Getty Images)

And Merson said he wasn't living up to Lukaku's record in terms of goals.

Merson added: "You can't sell goals. Lukaku was a goalscorer - he might not chase the full-back down but he puts the ball in the net and that is what it is all about."

Lifelong United fan Rashford, who has scored three goals this season, apologised to fans after the game , tweeting: "You can’t hide in football and the last few weeks simply haven’t been good enough.

"As a United fan myself, that hurts. And you deserve better.

"We know we need to improve and that is our sole focus as a team and as a club."
description: Rashford must learn from likes of Ian Wright and Gary Lineker as United struggle for goals
